content.raw:
Seems fine. I built the s3bucket image, but I didn't run it. If I understand correctly this container uploads to s3 bucket once and then exits. When it runs the simulation container and field computer container have finished.

I think it would make sense to create the script which will be run by cloudsim on the AWS instance (cloudsim_deploy.bash) which does the logic of running the containers and running this one after those two are done. It would help show where future pull requests fit into the whole system.
content.html:
Seems fine. I built the s3bucket image, but I didn't run it. If I understand correctly this container uploads to s3 bucket once and then exits. When it runs the simulation container and field computer container have finished.

I think it would make sense to create the script which will be run by cloudsim on the AWS instance (cloudsim_deploy.bash) which does the logic of running the containers and running this one after those two are done. It would help show where future pull requests fit into the whole system.
